faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about listing your property without an agent.

q1.question: Is it legal to rent my property without an agent in Thailand?
q1.answer: Absolutely! You have every right to rent your own property directly to tenants. Thousands of landlords in Thailand successfully manage their rentals without agents.

q2.question: What if I don't speak Thai fluently?
q2.answer: Our platform supports both Thai and English. Many expat landlords successfully use our tools, and we provide templates and guidance in both languages.

q3.question: How do I handle the legal paperwork?
q3.answer: We provide legally-compliant rental agreement templates that automatically fill in your property details. Our digital signature system makes the process fast and legally binding.

q4.question: What if I need help with difficult tenants?
q4.answer: Our platform includes tenant communication tools and we can connect you with legal services if needed. Many issues can be resolved through proper documentation and clear communication.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about selling your property with reduced commissions or DIY.

q1.question: How do your commission rates compare to traditional agents?
q1.answer: Our tiered structure offers 0.5% savings per tier: 3% vs 3.5% for under ฿5M, 2.5% vs 3% for ฿5M-15M, and 2% vs 2.5% for above ฿15M. This can save you ฿15,000-200,000+ depending on your property value.

q2.question: What's included in your agent service that traditional agents don't offer?
q2.answer: Transit station proximity marketing, professional virtual tours, advanced buyer screening, modern CRM tools, and performance analytics. Plus ongoing support throughout the entire sales process.

q3.question: Is the DIY option suitable for first-time sellers?
q3.answer: Yes! Our platform includes step-by-step guidance, legal document templates, and optional expert consultation. Many first-time sellers successfully use our DIY tools with excellent results.

q4.question: How long does it typically take to sell a property?
q4.answer: With our transit station proximity marketing and professional tools, properties typically sell 30% faster than traditional listings. Average time varies by location and price, but most sell within 60-90 days.
